intro: Ardisia candolleana, commonly known as the purple-leafed ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn a striking purple hue during the winter months. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia candolleana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
